sub_title: International Consultant Education and Out-of-School Services
summary:
At my age my goal is to share my experience and knowlegde with the next generation. That can be in teaching, research, or projects.
My field is education - school and out-of-school - for the age of 4 - 12 years old. For the field of (school-age) childcare I added parts of the theory, developed vocational training programs and a quality mark, wrote books and articles for practionioners, worked with politicians to support the field in legislation, and was co-founder en co-ordinator of the European Network for School-Age Childcare (ENSAC).
Lunchtime arrangements are a big deal in the Netherlands. My institute not only trains the voluntary workers, but it also organizes an annual and national conference, edits an on-line magazine and sends out newsletters.
Beyond that I worked, since 1997, in Eastern Europe and former Soviet states to re-organize the pre-school system in legislation, finance and content.

Specialismen: Education and training, government liaison, research and writing, international work

projects.title: Pre School in Kyrgyzstan (TA-4187-KGZ)
projects.description:
It was and is a large project to give back the 1 to 7 year olds their pre-school. These children have the right to prepare for elementary school, as in soviet times, but the curriculum and financing is new, and related to the new world the children are born into. I loved to work in a country where every community is child centered, and where the project members were so dedicated to their work. The ADB co-ordinator did a very good job here. Together we built pre-schools, developed a new curriculum and legislation, discussed financial options and the education of pre-school teachers. I was challenged on all levels concerning my field, and I loved it.
Please see adb.org and find our project reports.

contributors.headline: International Consultant Education and Out-of-School Services

projects.title: Early Childhood Development Project (TA-4115-AZE)
projects.description: Preschools/childcare centers for children in the age of 1 to 7 years old around Nagorno Karabakh were mainly taken over by refugees. There was very few left of the former soviet facilities. The aim of the main project was to develop a new preschool system, and take care of new housing. This short time project was the preparation of the main project.

contributors.headline: International Consultant Education and Out-of-School Services

projects.title: Addressing the Social Impact of Economic Restructuring and Privatisation in the Russian Federation (EDRUS 9410)
projects.description:
Local communities. This was an EU project, hosted by the VNG and French and Brittish partners, located in Moscow. The five partner cities were Novgorod, Volgograd, Astrachan, Tula, and Ribinsk. My field was early childhood education. Other fields were transport, city administration, health.
I am still dedicated to all the women in the field who taught me to understand the former soviet system, and therefore supported me to find new ways to re-organize the system.

contributors.headline: International Consultant Education and Out-of-School Services

projects.title: Raising the Quality of Learning beyond the Classroom (97-01-3PE-0473-00 & 98-01-3PE-0654-00)
projects.description: Homework in primary and compulsary secondary education in England, Germany, Greece, Italy, the Netherlands and Spain. Involved were the Thomas Coram Research Unit (London), the German Youth Institute (DJI) in Munich, the school inspection in Thessaloniki, the city of Bergamo, the University of Groningen (RuG) and Rosa Sensat (Barcelona).

contributors.headline: International Consultant Education and Out-of-School Services

projects.title: Stap Door!
projects.description:
Literacy First. The 'Stap Door!' program was a national program of the Ministry of Health and Welfare, hosted by Sardes. It succeeded headstart programs for preschool children. The keyword of the 'Stap Door!' program is 'tutoring'. Children from group 5 tutor children from group 2 in their reading skills. This is good for the younger children, because they have a 1 to 1 relationship with their tutor. It is also good for the older children, because the best way of learning is teaching someone else.
This project developped the program, method and materials. It proved to be a successful program, because it is still running, and the materials are still available.

contributors.headline: International Consultant Education and Out-of-School Services

projects.title: Verlengde Schooldag Experimenten
projects.description: Extended Schoolday Experiments. This was a project of the Ministry of Health and Welfare, hosted by NIZW. The project was explicitly not school-age childcare or out-of-school services. This project was about schools and children in disadvantaged urban areas in Amsterdam, Rotterdam, The Hague and Utrecht. The idea was to improve school results by offering an afterschool program.

profile_positions.description: IOS is the Dutch National Institute for Research and Development of School-Age Childcare. My institute develops programs for out-of-school services, and professional lunch time arrangements. We train staff for national standard qualifications. The institute also developed the national quality standard for lunch time arrangements in schools. We provide internships  and research projects for university students from all over the world who are interested in our field.
